name: Beejal Patel
background: Beejal Patel serves as Commissioning Editor, Documentaries at BBC. Focus areas: Documentaries. They are looking for: Single documentaries (60–90') with depth and nuance; series with diverse perspectives. Overall network strategy: The BBC seeks distinctive, authored documentary and specialist factual content that offers depth, intelligence and fresh perspectives while reflecting the diversity of UK audiences.
thematic_priorities: Contemporary social issues explored through personal stories
Natural history programming with innovative visual approaches and storytelling techniques
Science programming that makes complex topics accessible without oversimplification
History documentaries that connect past events to contemporary issues
Arts programming that celebrates British cultural excellence
Religion and ethics documentaries exploring faith in the modern world
Character-driven documentary series featuring extraordinary individuals or professions
Access-led series with institutions or communities rarely seen on television
Landmark series (3–6 episodes) that can define BBC Two's factual offering
target_audience: Broad UK audiences across BBC channels and iPlayer
format_specifications: Primetime where applicable; platform premieres for streamers
budget_parameters: Documentary: £150K–£350K per hour; Specialist Factual: £180K–£350K per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Accessibility: Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: One-page outline with premise, format, and episode breakdown
Details of secured or potential access
Key talent and production team credentials
additional_info: Ongoing; submissions accepted year-round unless strand-specific. Increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach. Emphasis on diverse voices on- and off-screen. Encouragement of sustainable production practices. Support for projects across the UK (where applicable). Open to pitches from independent producers/companies.
